quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Singer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, cashs, opening. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: This singer had a U.S. #1 hit in 1965 with Downtown.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Petula Clark

questions.question: From the opening line of Hello Darkness, my old friend to the ending line of The words of the prophets are written on the subway walls and tenement halls, this is a song about social isolation. According to the songwriter, where did his words, like silent raindrops, fall?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Sounds of Silence

questions.question: This group had a major hit song in 1980 with The Tide Is High.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Blondie

questions.question: The song Higher was a big hit song in 1999 for this band.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Creed

questions.question: Johnny Cashs first band was called the Landsberg Barbarians.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Rolling Stones had six songs on the list of 500 Songs That Shaped Rock N Roll. Which song told of a gin-soaked, bar-room queen in Memphis.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Honky Tonk Women

questions.question: At first listen, this song sounds like a sweet, endearing love song but on repeated plays, the lyrics become somewhat threatening. The songwriter himself calls the song very, very sinister and ugly. What is the name of this song by Gordon Sumner written after the breakup of his marriage to Frances Tomelty?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Every Breathe You Take

questions.question: The song Disco Lady was a mammoth hit for this singer in 1976.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johnnie Taylor

questions.question: The song Dark Lady was another U.S. #1 song for this singer in 1974.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cher

questions.question: Do you remember when we use to sing

options.text: Sad Eyed Lady of the Lowlands

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Brown Eyed Girl

questions.question: This band had a big hit song in 1970 called I Want to Take You Higher.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sly  the Family Stone

questions.question: Rocky Mountain High was a big hit song for this singer in 1974.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John Denver

questions.question: This one hit wonder from the 1970s had a huge hit song called Sky High.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Jigsaw

questions.question: Dont Worry, Be Happy was a colossal #1 hit for this singer in 1988.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bobby McFerrin

questions.question: What group gave us the U.S. #1 song Dont You Want Me in 1982?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Human League

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Song and Lyrics
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, people, title. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Johnny Cash is the first person to ever be sued by the Federal Government for starting a forest fire.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What is the title of the song by Aretha Franklin that contains the lyrics, I aint gonna do you wrong while youre gone; Aint gonna do you wrong cause I dont wanna?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Respect

questions.question: Name the Stevie Wonder song that features the following lyrics: No April rain, No flowers bloom, No wedding Saturday within the month of June.

options.text: You Are The Sunshine Of My Life
I Just Called to Say I Love You

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Just Called to Say I Love You

questions.question: Bow Wow looks up to Jermaine Duprie and Snoop Dogg.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The lines Life is a mystery, everyone must stand alone; I hear you call my name and it feels like home are from which popular song by Madonna?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Like a Prayer

questions.question: The following lyrics are from this song performed by Prince: Dream if u can a courtyard; An ocean of violets in bloom; Animals strike curious poses.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: When Doves Cry

questions.question: Which song, written by Merle Kilgore and June Carter, was Johnny Cashs first major cross-over hit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ring of Fire

questions.question: What quartet got its start on Johnny Cashs TV show?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Statler Brothers

questions.question: Which Elvis Presley song contains the lyrics, Well, the Bell hops tears keep flowin, and the desk clerks dressed in black.?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Heartbreak Hotel

questions.question: The lyrics Friday night and the lights are low, Looking out for the place to go are from this popular song by ABBA.

options.text: Gimme! Gimme! Gimme! (A Man After Midnight)

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Dancing Queen

questions.question: What is the title of Donna Summers song that contains the lyrics, Lookin for a lover who needs another; Dont want another night on my own?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hot Stuff

questions.question: What is the title of the song by The Police containing the lyrics, O cant you see, You belong to me, How my poor heart aches with every step you take?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Every Breath You Take

questions.question: The lines People always told me be careful of what you do, and dont go around breaking young girls hearts are from which Michael Jackson song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Billie Jean

questions.question: What is the title of the song by R. Kelly that features the lyrics, But now I know the meaning of true love, Im leaning on the everlasting arms?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: I Believe I Can Fly

questions.question: Which were the first two songs by Johnny Cash to be released by Sun Records in 1955?

options.text: Cry, Cry, Cry and Hey Porter
Folsum Prison Blues and I Walk The Line
Hey Porter and I Walk The Line
Dont Take Your Guns To Town and I Walk The Line

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cry, Cry, Cry and Hey Porter

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movie and Liv
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, funks, groupie. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What is Bow Wows real first name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shad

questions.question: What was the first record label Bow Wow signed with?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Death Row Records

questions.question: Bow Wow is known to be on bad terms with which American rapper and actor?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Romeo

questions.question: Bow Wow made his acting debut in what 2002 movie?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Like Mike

questions.question: Can I get you a taxi home
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Whats Your Name

questions.question: This lady was a model and former Playmate of the Month and living with singer Todd Rundgren when she had a daughter named Liv. It was during a concert that her daughter Liv first met Steve Tyler of Aerosmith and later met Mia Tyler, Steve Tylers daughter. After meeting Mia, Liv turned to her mother and asked Is Steve Tyler my Father? What is the name of Liv Tylers mother?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Bebe Buell

questions.question: This singer had one of the biggest hits of 1990 with the song Ice, Ice Baby.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vanilla Ice

questions.question: Director Cameron Crowe wrote and directed this movie that is based on his experiences as a very young journalist for Rolling Stone Magazine. Kate Hudson starred as the groupie Penny Lane in this movie. In what movie did Penny Lane justify her love for a rock singer by saying You dont know what he says to me in private. Maybe it is love-as much as it can be?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Almost Famous

questions.question: Bonnie Bramlett wrote and recorded the song Groupie (Superstar). By 1972 the title had been cleaned up and the word Groupie dropped. Who had a # 2 Billboard hit with this song?

options.text: nt you remember! You told me you loved me, baby
by, baby, baby, baby oh baby, I love you. I really do.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Carpenters

questions.question: In Grand Funks song Were An American Band, the band has been on the road for forty days and nights. But last night in Little Rock put me in a haze.  What sweet sweet girl was doin her act.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Connie

questions.question: This famous groupie was able to to turn her friendship into a lasting art. She started creating exact replicas of certain body parts of famous musicians. What is the first name of the lady known as the Plaster Caster?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cynthia

questions.question: Baby, Come To Me was a #1 U.S. hit for this duo in 1983.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: James Ingram and Patti Austin

questions.question: Which one of these songs by Bow Wow features American RB band Jagged Edge?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Puppy Love

questions.question: Is it true that Bow Wow and American RB and pop singer Chris Brown are friends?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Yes

questions.question: As stated in the movie Almost Famous, what is the more preferred term for ardent followers of famous bands?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Band Aids

When all was said and done, they could have easily been voted into the Hall of Shame. Either way, they provided us with the  U.S. #1 song in 1989 called Baby, Dont Forget My Number.

questions.question: What 1973 album is considered Pink Floyds most successful release?

options.text: The Dark Side of the Moon

options.text: The Piper at the Gates of Dawn

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Wang Chung and Group

questions.question: The  original name of the band Wang Chung was Huang Chung.

options.text: ... and in her eyes, youll see such bliss
... and make her do what I insist
... and dance her to unpromised risk

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: ...and in her mouth an amethyst

questions.question: What does Wang Chung mean, in the context of the famous British band?

options.text: This is the name of an ancient Chinese dynasty, which the band eponymously claimed as their own.
The sound a guitar makes when its strummed in a certain fashion.
This was the password originally used to get their friends backstage following a concert of theirs.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The sound a guitar makes when its strummed in a certain fashion.
